    • Method Detail

      • findSingle

        public static int findSingle​(int[] a)
        Function findSingle that received a complete array of integers, where each number appears twice, except one number that appears only once. The function returns the number that appears in the array only once.
        Parameters:
        a - The received array
        Returns:
        The number that appears in the array only once

      • smallestSubSum

        public static int smallestSubSum​(int[] arr,
                                 int x)
        Function smallestSubSum that received a complete array of positive integers and a positive number. The function returns the size of the smallest subset in the array whose sum is larger than the given number. If the array is empty or there is no subset whose sum is greater than the given number, the function returns -1.
        Parameters:
        arr - The received array
        x - The received number
        Returns:
        The size of the smallest subset that is larger than the number

      • solutions

        public static int solutions​(int num)
        Recursive function - solutions that received a positive integers - num. The function returns the number of solutions of the equation x1 + x2 + x3 = num. x's are integers and positive numbers between 1 and 10. The function also prints these solutions, each solution in a separate line.
        Parameters:
        num - The received number
        Returns:
        The number of solutions of the equation x1 + x2 + x3 = num

      • cntTrueReg

        public static int cntTrueReg​(boolean[][] mat)
        Recursive Function - cntTrueReg that received a boolean matrix and returns the number of true region in the matrix. A true region in the array is defined by a maximum collection of adjacent cells that all have true value. Cells located diagonally to each other are not considered adjacent.
        Parameters:
        mat - The received matrix of boolean
        Returns:
        The number of true region in the matrix
